alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coshocton; Guernsey; Harrison; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:54PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN HARRISON...NORTHERN GUERNSEY...EASTERN COSHOCTON...NORTHERN MUSKINGUM...SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM EDT... At 1254 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sugarcreek to near North Zanesville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, New Philadelphia, Coshocton, Cambridge, Uhrichsville, Freeport, Newcomerstown, Dennison, New Concord, Byesville, West Lafayette, and North Zanesville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 146 and 189. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 43 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for east central Ohio.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Coshocton; Guernsey; Harrison; Muskingum; Tuscarawas
